intro: Melicope, commonly known as the pepper tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rutaceae. It consists of approximately 150 species, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, Africa, and Asia. The plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their aromatic, often resinous leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. Many species produce berries or drupes, which can be an important food source for various animals. The genus is notable for its ecological importance and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
